title: Science Learning Motivation Design Program Based on the ARCS Model (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary science education foundational theories and practical experience
context.additional_context: A course for practicing elementary teachers to master methods of motivating learners using the ARCS model in science lesson design. Conducted through practice-oriented education utilizing VR/simulation tools in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to apply the four elements of the ARCS model (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction) to elementary science lessons.
Learners can develop specific lesson scenarios by applying ARCS-based motivational design strategies in VR simulation environments.
Learners can analyze the motivational effectiveness of science lesson designs developed through peer assessment with over 80% accuracy.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
